question:
Consider the following statements about the Swasthya Raksha Programme:
  1. It is an initiative under the AYUSH Ministry
  2. It has been launched to promote health and health education in villages
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation:
First statement is correct because the Swasthya Raksha Programme is an initiative from Ministry of AYUSH. Second statement is again correct because it has been launched to promote health and health education in villages.
The Program will be implemented with the help of four bodies viz. Central Council for Research in Ayurvedic Sciences (CCRAS), Central Council for Research in Unani Medicine (CCRUM), Central Council for Research in Homoeopathy (CCRH) and Central Council for Research in Siddha (CCRS) in selected districts/ villages. The objectives of the program are:
  • To organize Swasthya Rakshan OPDs, Swasthya Parikshan Camps and spread the cleanliness awareness programme
  • Provide medical aid/incidental support in the adopted Colonies/villages
  • Documentation of demographic information, food habits, hygiene conditions, seasons, lifestyle etc., incidence/prevalence of disease and their relation to the incidence of disease
  • Assessment of health status and propagation of Ayurvedic concept of pathya-apathya and extension of health care services
